title: Is NCERT enough to score 300+ marks in JEE Mains? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: Well, A Big No! You can't Score 300+ by Just Studying NCERT. For Physics, you have to Follow a standard Book or Coaching Material along with NCERT. For Maths, Use NCERT For Building Basics then Do your coaching Material and Then a standard Book Like TMH, Cengage etc. For Chemistry, for Inorganic and Organic you don't need Anything apart from NCERT But for Physical Do The Questions Provided by Your Coaching or Some Book.

Refer one MCQ book till the end. The MTG book Series is a Fantastic Book. Make sure you keep practicing the MCQS again and again.When you study from these books make sure you make your own mind map, study charts and notes that will help you with quick revision of the concept.Physics includes- Concepts, Theory, Derivations, Numerical. You have to first get the concepts, theory,derivatives cleared to being with the numerical.Chemistry includes- Concepts, Equations, Mechanisms, Theory, Numerical. Your concepts and theory has to be clear, to begin withe the equations, mechanism and numerical. In chemistry it also become important on how you are studying the equations. You cannot read or by-heart an equation, you need to write them and write them and write them .. till its imprinted in your system.Biology includes- Theory, facts and Concepts. For biology, you have to read! The entire book has to be read atleast 3 times.Make sure you make a very good time table, allot yourself plenty time to go through the chap, revise well and also test yourself. You can start by making time table for a week then 10 days and so on.Solve as many test papers as possible. Start with chapter wise test and then move to mock test.
